G4432-d-11-03-98-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Other causes relating to train handling or makeup (Provide detailed description in narrative)
G4432-d-11-03-98-WC.Accident Cause: Other causes relating to train handling or makeup (Provide detailed description in narrative)
G4432-d-11-03-98-WC.Narrative: TRAIN TO44:  CONSISTING OF 3 WORKING LOCOMOTIVES, 5 DEAD-IN-TOW LOCOMOTIVES, 55 LOADS AND 46 EMPTIES, WAS PREPARING TO MEET A WESTBOUND TRAIN IN WAUKESHA, WISCONSIN.  AS THE TRAIN BEGAN ITS STOP, THEENGINEER WAS USING THE DYNAMIC BRAKE, APPLIED MINIMUM AIR AND THEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  THE CONDUCTOR THEN WALKED BACK TO FIND THAT 2 OF THE DEAD-IN-TOW" LOCOMOTIVE AND 6 CARS HAD DERAILED.THE INVESTIGATION INTO THIS INCIDENT REVEALED THAT THE DERAILMENT WAS CAUSED BY TRANSPORTING 5 "DEAD-IN-TOW" LOCOMOTIVE THAT WERE NOT EQUIPPED WITH COUIPLER LIMITING DEVICES.  THESE "DEAD-IN-TOW" LOCOMOTIVES WERE POSITIONED DIRECTLY BEHIND THE 3 WORKING LOCOMOTIVE AND FOLLOWED BY THE LOADED AND EMPTY CARS.  THE WAY IN WHICH THE "DEAD-IN-TOW" LOCOMOTIVES WERE BEING TRANSPORTED WAS IN VIOLATION OFWISCONSIN CENTRAL'S AIR BRAKES RULE #20.10.  DUE TO THE FACT THAT NUMEROUS EMPLOYEE FAILED TO NOTETHE PROMBLEMS WITH THE EQUIPMENT IN THE TRAIN, FROM THE OPERATIONS CENTER DOWN TO THE CONDUCTOR, NOINDIVIDUAL EMPLOYEE CAN BE ASSIGNED PERSONAL RESPONSIBILITY.  IT WOULD BE IMPOSSIBLE TO INDENTIFIEDALL OF THE EMPLOYEE THAT WOULD'VE BEEN DIRECTLY INVOLVED WITH THIS INCIDENT.NoneNoneNone

98048-d-11-23-98-TM.Narrative: THERE WAS NO SINGLE CAUSE BUT A COMBINATION.  THE TRACK IN THE AREA IS WITHIN TRACK STADARDS FOR CLASS 1 TRACK.  THIS AREA IS A 5 DEGREE LEFT HAND CURVE AND THE TRAIN WAS TRAVELING AT 6 MPH.  THE 45THCAR, ACFX51816, LEADING COMPARTMENT WAS HEAVY LOADED OR THE TRAILING COMPARMENT WAS MUCH LIGHTER LOADED AS THE SPRINGS ON THE LEADING TRUCKS WERE MORE COMPRESSED THAN THE TRAILINGTRUCK CREATING SOMERIGIDNESS IN LEADING TRUCK; AND THIS COUPLED WITH BUFF FORCE AS THERE IS A DESCENDING GRADE APPROXIMATELY 500 FEET BEFORE AN ASCENDING GRADE AND JUST PAST THE POINT OF DERAILMENT THERE IS A DESCENDINGGRADE AND 1,000 FEET LATER THE TRACK ASCENDS AGAIN; AND THIS RESULTED IN WHEEL CLIMB ON THE OUTSIDELEADING WHEEL OF ACFX CAR RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT.  IN ALL PROBABILITY THIS DERAILMENT WOULD NOT HAVE OCCURRED, IF NOT FOR THESE COMBINATIONS BEING PRESENT SIMULTANEOUSLY.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

THE DERAILED CAR THEN TRAVELED 1.6 MILES ON TIES BEFORE CAUSING A 5 CAR DERAILMENT AT MP 55.5.  ALL DERAILED CARS ARE ON THEIR SIDES, DESTROYING 500' OF MAIN LINE.  TRAIN HAD ROLL BY INSPECTIONS AT MP 79.0 AMD MP 72.8 WITH NO EXCEPTIONS.  THE 5 DERAILED CARS WERE THE TRAILING 5 CARS, WITH 3 CARS LAYING TO THE NORTH SIDE OF MAIN LINE AND 2 CARS TO THE SOUTH SIDE OF MAIN LINE.  ENGINEER HAD MADE AN 11LB REDUCTION THEN RELEASED AIR FOR 20 SECONDS BEFORE MAKING A 16 LOAD REDUCTION CAUSING SEVERE BUFFFORCES. TRAIN WAS ALSO 6 MPH OVER SPEED LIMIT AT POINT OF DERAILMENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

ID98552-d-11-17-98-ISRR.Narrative: ISRR TRAIN CREW CUT AWAY FROM 58 IP&L EMPTIES ON THE MAIN TRACK AT PEABODY, AND HAD PULLED INTO THEPOCKET TRACK TO CLEAR THE DOUBLE CROSSOVER THAT LED FROM THE MAIN TRACK TO THE SIDING AND BACK OVERTO THE MAIN.  PEABODY THEN TIED ONTO THE 58 EMPTIES AND PULLED THE TRAIN THROUGH THE DOUBLE CROSSOVER, GOING AROUND THE ISRR LOCOMOTIVE POWER, BACK TO THE MAIN, TO A POINT WHERE THE PEABODY CREW COULDMAKE A CUT ON 38 CARS.  AFTER MAKING A CUT ON THE MAIN, THE PEABODY CREW COULD MAKE A CUT ON 38 CARS.  AFTER MAKING A CUT ON THE MAIN, THE PEABODY CREW CONTINUED PULLING  38 IP&L CARS THROUGH THE CROSSOVER AND STOPPED TO CLEAR THE SECOND SWITCH OF THE DOUBLE CROSSOVER ON THE SIDING.  AT THIS POINT,THE PEABODY CREW DID NOT REALIZE THAT THEY HAD RUN THROUGH THE LAST SWITCH OF THE DOUBLE CROSSOVER(THE ONE THAT LEADS TO THE MAIN), AND HAD 5 CARS STOPPED BEHIND THAT HAD RUN THROUGH THE SWITCH.  ASTHE PEABODY CREW MADE A REVERSE MOVE TO SPOT THEIR TRAIN, THEY DERAILED 4 CARS AND SHOVED ONE CAR INTO ONE OF THE ISRR LOCOMOTIVES (WG-1) THAT WERE PARKED IN THE POCKET TRACK IN THE CLEAR.NoneNoneNoneNone
